column4: I am not able to install ubuntu 9.04 through a CD as the display gets screwed up. What do I do ?
which graphics card?
I think it is the NVIDIA Geforce
I dont have any other CD for the moment. I could upgrade it later once done with initial bot
And it is NVIDIA Quadro F 550
maybe you have a bad CD
No, It works on other machines
It just does not have the right driver. How can I tell it to not use the graphics card for the display ?
well there will be some sort of build in open source driver type thing that NIvida will use, and if you can't use that well
oh your booting up into the live session?  have you tried just the install option?
There is just one option at the boot : "Install Ubuntu" ...
which CD?
Ah...9.04 ... Can I do an install from the command line . I see that the terminals are ready
well  don't think so with the desktop CD, the alternate maybe so
I don't know
yes you can remove Ubuntu One :)
also you need an acstaul Ubuntu One account to use it
Ok , thank you
Your welcome :)
Ubuntu One is something I don't want to use either :)
